ES 1- 2.title: Intercollegiate Baseball
ES 1- 2.description: The course provides students the opportunity to compete, improve their physical condition, and refine their skills through vigorous training and neuromuscular development.

ES 1- 4A.title: Elementary Badminton
ES 1- 4A.description: A course designed to provide students with the opportunity to improve their basic physical condition, secure useful neuromuscular development, and gain recreational skills.

ES 1- 4B.title: Intermediate Badminton
ES 1- 4B.description: A course designed to provide students with the opportunity to improve their basic physical condition, secure useful neuromuscular development, and gain recreational skills.

ES 1- 5B.title: Intermediate Baseball
ES 1- 5B.description: A course designed to provide students with the opportunity to improve their basic physical condition, secure useful neuromuscular development, and gain recreational skills.

ES 1- 5C.title: Advanced Baseball
ES 1- 5C.description: Provides students with the opportunity to improve their basic physical condition, secure useful neuromuscular development, and gain recreational skills.

ES 1- 6A.title: Elementary Basketball
ES 1- 6A.description: A course designed to provide students with the opportunity to improve their basic physical condition, secure useful neuromuscular development, and gain recreational skills.

ES 1- 6B.title: Intermediate Basketball
ES 1- 6B.description: A course designed to provide students with the opportunity to improve their basic physical condition, secure useful neuromuscular development, and gain recreational skills.

ES 1- 6C.title: Advanced Basketball
ES 1- 6C.description: Provides students with the opportunity to improve their basic physical condition, secure useful neuromuscular development, and gain recreational skills.

ES 1- 7A.title: Elementary Boating and Sailing
ES 1- 7A.description: A course designed to provide students with the opportunity to improve theirbasic physical condition, secure useful neuromuscular development, and gainrecreational skills.

ES 1- 7B.title: Intermediate Boating & Sailing
ES 1- 7B.description: A course designed to provide students with the opportunity to improve theirbasic physical condition, secure useful neuromuscular development, and gain recreational skills.

ES 1- 9A.title: Elementary Bowling
ES 1- 9A.description: A course designed to provide students with the opportunity to improve their basic physical condition, secure useful neuromuscular development, and gain recreational skills.

ES 1- 10A.title: Elementary Aerobic and Fitness Conditioning
ES 1- 10A.description: Introduction to fitness training techniques that address aerobic conditioning, muscular endurance, muscular strength and flexibility.

ES 1- 10B.title: Intermediate Aerobic and Fitness Conditioning
ES 1- 10B.description: Presentation and practice of variety of fitness training techniques (high/low impact, step and resistance training) addressing aerobic conditioning, muscular strength and muscular endurance.

ES 1- 10C.title: Advanced Aerobic and Fitness Conditioning
ES 1- 10C.description: An advanced level course including high/low impact, step, resistance and anaerobic training techniques. cross-training, injury prevention and body alignment priciples will be accentuated.

ES 1- 11.title: Intercollegiate Basketball
ES 1- 11.description: The course provides students the opportunity to compete, improve their physical condition, and refine their skills through vigorous training and neuromuscular development.

ES 1- 12.title: Indoor Cycling
ES 1- 12.comments: Quarters usually offered: Winter, Spring, Fall.
ES 1- 12.description: Introduction to the basic concepts of indoor cycling. The relationship between indoor cycling and cardiovasular fitness is explored. Appropriate for individuals of all levels of fitness and experience.

ES 1- 12A.title: Elementary Cycling
ES 1- 12A.description: Designed to give the student a basic understanding of the principlies of cycling, including pedal cadence, shifting, gear ratios, training, safety, and maintenance.

ES 1- 13A.title: Elementary Fencing
ES 1- 13A.description: The objective of this course is to obtain the basic techniques and theory fundamental to fencing. Satisfactory progress will allow advancement to the intermediate class.

ES 1- 13B.title: Intermediate Fencing
ES 1- 13B.description: Students obtain the basic techniques and theory fundamental to fencing. Satisfactory progress will allow advancement to the advanced class.

ES 1- 13C.title: Advanced Fencing
ES 1- 13C.description: Utilizes basic fundamentals and techniques in acquiring advanced skills of fencing.

ES 1- 14.title: Intercollegiate Cross Country
ES 1- 14.description: The course provides students the opportunity to compete, improve their physical condition, and refine their skills through vigorous training and neuromuscular development.

ES 1- 15A.title: Introduction to Yoga
ES 1- 15A.description: Introduction to Yoga principles, techniques and poses that address physical and emotional wellbeing will be presented.

ES 1- 15B.title: Intermediate Yoga
ES 1- 15B.description: Presentation and practice of a variety of yoga techniques (yoga flow, yoga sculpt) addressing muscular strength, core conditioning and flexibility.

ES 1- 15C.title: Advanced Yoga
ES 1- 15C.description: An advanced level course including a variety of yoga techniques. Advanced poses are introduced to challenge balance, core strength, and flexibility.

ES 1- 16A.title: Elementary Ballroom Dance
ES 1- 16A.description: Introduction to a variety of movement skills and sequences necessary to perform the foxtrot, swing, tango, waltz, mambo, salsa, and other popular social dances.

ES 1- 16B.title: Intermediate Ballroom Dance
ES 1- 16B.description: Designed to provide students with the opportunity to improve upon the variety of movement skills and sequences necessary to perform the foxtrot, swing, tango, waltz, mambo, salsa, and other popular social dances.

ES 1- 17.title: Introduction to Capoeira - Brazilian Martial Art
ES 1- 17.description: An introduction to the Afro-Brazilian martial art that presents elements of self-defense, acrobatics, music, dance and ritual. Students will improve their body's physical strength, power and flexibility, as well as their mind's concentration, self-confidence, courage and creativity.

ES 1- 18D.title: Theatrical Fencing
ES 1- 18D.description: A course designed for drama majors which covers the use of the sabre, epee,and dagger in theatrical productions. Proficiency in the class does not prepare the individual for contest participation but rather the use of these instruments in acting.

ES 1- 22.title: Intercollegiate Golf
ES 1- 22.comments: May be repeated to a maximum of six units.
ES 1- 22.description: The course provides students the opportunity to compete, improve their physical condition, and refine their skills through vigorous training and neuromuscular development. 6 unit maximum.

ES 1- 24A.title: Elementary Golf
ES 1- 24A.description: A course designed to provide students with the opportunity to improve theirbasic physical condition, secure useful neuromuscular development, and gain recreational skills.

ES 1- 24B.title: Intermediate Golf
ES 1- 24B.description: A course designed to provide students with the opportunity to improve theirbasic physical condition, secure useful neuromuscular development, and gain recreational skills.

ES 1- 25A.title: Elementary Tumbling and Free Exercise
ES 1- 25A.description: Affords a basic background for the sport of gymnastics with a working knowledge of tumbling skills progressing from basic mat somersaults, kips, balances, etc., to intermediate and advanced routines as used in both the men's and women's competitive tumbling and free exercise events.

ES 1- 25B.title: Intermediate Tumbling and Free Exercise
ES 1- 25B.description: Affords a basic background for the sport of gymnastics with a working knowledge of tumbling skills progressing from basic mat somersaults, kips, balances, etc., to advanced routines as used in both the men's and women's competitive tumbling and free exercise events.

ES 1- 25C.title: Advanced Tumbling and Free Exercise
ES 1- 25C.description: Affords a working knowledge of tumbling skills in an advanced level.

ES 1- 26A.title: Elementary Gymnastics Apparatus
ES 1- 26A.description: Offers basic, intermediate, and advanced instruction for both men and women in all olympic events except for exercise. Step by step progressions leading to competitive style routines are taught for each of the three ability levels.

ES 1- 26B.title: Intermediate Gymnastics Apparatus
ES 1- 26B.description: Offers basic, intermediate and advanced instruction for both men and women in all olympic events except for exercise. Step by step progressions leading to competitive style routines are taught for each of the three ability levels.

ES 1- 29A.title: Elementary Raquetball
ES 1- 29A.description: The course provides students the opprotunity to compete in elementary racquetball, improve their physical condition, and refine their skills through vigorous training and neuromuscular development.

ES 1- 29B.title: Intermediate Racquetball
ES 1- 29B.description: The course provides students the opportunity to compete in intermediate racquetball, improve their physical condition, and refine their skills through vigorous training and neuromuscular development.

ES 1- 30A.title: Elementary Soccer
ES 1- 30A.description: A course designed to provide students with the opportunity to improve theirbasic physical condition, secure useful neuromuscular development, and gain recreational skills.

ES 1- 30B.title: Intermediate Soccer
ES 1- 30B.description: A course designed to provide students with the opportunity to improve their basic physical condition, secure useful neuromuscular development, and gain recreational skills.

ES 1- 31A.title: Softball -- Elementary
ES 1- 31A.description: A course designed to provide students with the opportunity to improve their basic physical condition, secure useful neuromuscular development, and gain recreational skills.

ES 1- 31B.title: Softball -- Intermediate
ES 1- 31B.description: A course designed to provide students with the opportunity to improve their basic physical condition, secure useful neuromuscular development, and gain recreational skills.

ES 1- 31C.title: Softball--Advanced
ES 1- 31C.description: Provides students with the opportunity to improve their basic physical condition, secure useful neuromuscular development, and gain recreational skills.

ES 1- 32.title: Intercollegiate Softball
ES 1- 32.description: The course provides students the opportunity to compete, improve their physical condition, and refine their skills through vigorous training and neuromuscular development.

ES 1- 33.title: Intercollegiate Swimming
ES 1- 33.description: The course provides students the opportunity to compete, improve their physical condition, and refine their skills through vigorous training and neuromuscular development.

ES 1- 34A.title: Elementary Swimming
ES 1- 34A.description: A course designed to provide students with the opportunity to improve their basic physical condition, secure useful neuromuscular development, and gain recreational skills.

ES 1- 34B.title: Intermediate Swimming
ES 1- 34B.description: A course designed to provide students with the opportunity to improve their basic physical condition, secure useful neuromuscular development, and gain recreational skills.

ES 1- 35A.title: Elementary Sychronized Swimming
ES 1- 35A.description: This course provides students the opportunity to learn the skills essential to the successful completion of a synchronized swimming routine. Introduction to composition, music selection principles and governing body rules and regulations.

ES 1- 36.title: Jogging Fitness
ES 1- 36.description: Jogging (majority of work), stair running, indoor and out-door apparatus, information on various methods of obtaining cardiovascular fitness: long slow distance, interval training, repetition training.

ES 1- 37.title: Intercollegiate Tennis
ES 1- 37.description: The course provides students the opportunity to compete, improve their physical condition, and refine their skills through vigorous training and neuromuscular development.

ES 1- 38A.title: Elementary Tennis
ES 1- 38A.description: A course designed to provide students with the opportunity to improve theirbasic physical condition, secure useful neuromuscular development, and gain recreational skills.

ES 1- 38B.title: Intermediate Tennis
ES 1- 38B.description: A course designed to provide students with the opportunity to improve their basic physical condition, secure useful neuromuscular development, and gain recreational skills.

ES 1- 38C.title: Advanced Tennis
ES 1- 38C.description: Provides students with the opportunity to improve their basic physical condition, secure useful neuromuscular development, and gain recreational skills.

ES 1- 40A.title: Elementary Volleyball
ES 1- 40A.description: A course designed to provide students with the opportunity to improve their basic physical condition, secure useful neuromuscular development, and gain recreational skills.

ES 1- 40B.title: Intermediate Volleyball
ES 1- 40B.description: A course designed to provide students with the opportunity to improve their basic physical condition, secure useful neuromuscular development, and gain recreational skills.

ES 1- 40C.title: Advanced Volleyball
ES 1- 40C.description: A course designed to provide students with the opportunity to improve their basic physical condition, secure useful neuromuscular development, and gain recreational skills.

ES 1- 41A.title: Elementary Water Polo
ES 1- 41A.description: A course designed to provide students with the opportunity to improve their basic physical condition, secure useful neuromuscular development, and gain recreational skills.

ES 1- 41B.title: Intermediate Water Polo
ES 1- 41B.description: A course designed to provide students with the opportunity to improve their basic physical condition, secure useful neuromuscular development, and gain recreational skills.

ES 1- 42.title: Intercollegiate Track and Field
ES 1- 42.comments: May be repeated to a maximum of six units.
ES 1- 42.description: The course provides students the opportunity to compete, improve their physical condition, and refine their skills through vigorous training and neuromuscular development.

ES 1- 43A.title: Beginning Weight Training
ES 1- 43A.description: A course designed for the general college population, introducing and supporting concepts, principles and proper techniques of conditioning with an emphasis on strength training.

ES 1- 43B.title: Intermediate Weight Training
ES 1- 43B.description: A course emphasizing advanced concepts, principles and proper techniques of conditioning with an emphasis on strength training.

ES 1- 43D.title: Conditioning/Weight Training
ES 1- 43D.description: Designed for members of intercollegiate teams who wish to develop and maintain a base level of physical fitness particular to their activity.

ES 1- 43E.title: Weight Training for Women
ES 1- 43E.description: Designed to improve women's muscular endurance and strength through proper utilization of strength training equipment and other forms of resistance training. Emphasis on anatomical considerations, physical capabilities and individual goals.

ES 1- 45.title: Intercollegiate Water Polo
ES 1- 45.comments: May be repeated to a maximum of six units.
ES 1- 45.description: The course provides students the opportunity to compete, improve their physical condition, and refine their skills through vigorous training and neuromuscular development.

ES 1- 47.title: Intercollegiate Volleyball
ES 1- 47.description: The course provides students the opportunity to compete, improve their physical condition, and refine their skills through vigorous training and neuromuscular development.

ES 1- 48.title: Intercollegiate Soccer
ES 1- 48.comments: May be repeated to a maximum of six units.
ES 1- 48.description: The course provides students the opportunity to compete, improve their physical condition, and refine their skills through vigorous training and neuromuscular development.

ES 1- 59A.title: Elementary Aqua Aerobics
ES 1- 59A.description: A course designed to provide an opportunity to enhance cardiovascular fitness and muscular strength. Exercises will be performed to music in water which provides natural resistance, control, and support for the body.

ES 1- 59B.title: Intermediate Aqua Aerobics
ES 1- 59B.description: A course designed to provide an opportunity to enhance cardiovascular fitness, muscular strength and flexibility through the use of water resistive equipment.

ES 1- 99.title: Lifetime Activities Interest Class
ES 1- 99.comments: Enrollment not to exceed two sections of PA 1-99 per quarter. Students are limited to 5 units per quarter and 30 units total in all 98/99/198/199/199DC/199RA courses combined.
ES 1- 99.description: This class makes it possible for a student to take instruction beyond the elementary, intermediate, and advanced levels of any physical activities 1- class.
